meanings.definition: A collection of miscellaneous items or articles.
meanings.sent1: She kept all her old toys in a ragbags in the attic.
meanings.sent2: The garage sale had a table full of ragbags for sale.
meanings.sent3: The ragbags in her room made it look like a treasure trove.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a ragbags of memories, some clear and some faded.
meanings.sent5: The ragbags of buttons spilled out of the jar onto the floor.

meanings.sent1: The classroom was a ragbags of papers and books.
meanings.sent2: The party turned into a ragbags of people dancing and chatting.
meanings.sent3: His explanation was a ragbags of jumbled words that made no sense.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were a ragbags of sounds and smells.
meanings.sent5: The old shed was a ragbags of tools and gardening supplies.
